page.title: 09VILLAGE STORE
page.content: Built in the early 1800 the{POST {OFFICE & STORE}was owned by William Green Philips in 1880.Who retired in 1912.In those days the post office was also the{VILLAGE BAKERY.}The post office was then passed to Mr. William Robert Philips.Father of "Bill" Philips who still lives in the village today.During the 2nd WORLD WAR William Robert Philips became a sergeant in the Fulstow Home Guard,which used to meet in a hut in the gardens at the rear of the Post Office.His wife was the daughter of the village school master.{(Interesting to note is that {the school was built in 1866 at a cost {of Â£250 for 100 pupils.)}In 1885 Mr. W.G.Philips salary as sub_postmaster was Â£290_9d per quarter.Altogether the village post office remained in the same family for 84 years.The first telephones came to Fulstow in 1925.
